text: Henri Grenier (20 May 1899 – 5 May 1980) was a French Canadian priest, theologian, and philosopher. He was the author of a manual of Thomistic philosophy, once widely used in Roman Catholic seminaries. ==Life== Grenier was born in Gaspé, Quebec, and ordained for the diocese of Gaspé in 1924. He studied philosophy at the Angelicum in Rome (1924-1926), and at the major seminary in Gaspé (1926-1927). From 1927-1930 he studied theology at the Angelicum and Canon law at the Pontifical Lateran University. He held doctorates in philosophy, theology, and canon law. From 1930 to 1947 he was professor of theology at the seminary of Québec. In 1938 he was incardinated in the diocese of Québec. He spent a year in Oklahoma, 1944-1945. He was for many years professor of philosophy at the Université Laval. ==Work== Grenier's Cursus Philosophiae was originally written in Latin, and was then translated into French and English. Gavan Monaghan called the publication of the Cursus "a milestone in the teaching of thomistic philosophy."Letter to the Editor of the Manitoba Ensign The Thomist praised the Cursus for adhering faithfully to "the mind and teaching of St. Thomas and Aristotle."Ignatius McGuiness, Review of Cursus Philosophiae, in: The Thomist 9.3 (1946), 466 Along with Charles De Koninck and Louis Lachance, Grenier was a prominent Thomist critic of personalism.Marie Martin-Hubbard, “Incursion personnaliste chez les thomistes canadiens-français des années 1930 et 1940 : l’exemple de François Hertel ” ==References== ==External links== * Thomistic Philosophy - Volume 1: Logic and Philosophy of Nature * Thomistic Philosophy - Volume 2: Metaphysics * Thomistic Philosophy - Volume 3: Moral Philosophy * biography of Grenier * Excerpt from Grenier's manual of philosophy, with a biographical note * Thomistic Philosophy, Volume 3: Moral Philosophy in PDF format *Thomistic Philosophy - Volume 1–2: Logic, Philosophy of Nature and Metaphysics in PDF format (in French) *Thomistic Philosophy - Volume 3: Moral Philosophy in PDF format (in French) Category:1899 births Category:1980 deaths Category:Canadian philosophers Category:Thomist philosophers Category:Catholic philosophers Category:Université Laval faculty Category:People from Gaspé, Quebec Category:20th-century philosophers
